revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Pheenet |model=WAP-654G |image1=wap-654g-case.jpg |price=50 |est_release_date=2007 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |type=access point, repeater |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8186 |cpu1_cspeed=180 |fla1=2 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX29LV160CBTC-70G |ram1=16 |ram1_brand=ISSI |ram1_model=IS42S16800A-7TL |jtag=yes,, 12-pad header,, J1 |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, JPU1 |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8186 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |eth_chip1_brand=Realtek |eth_chip1_model=RTL8201CP |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |flags=high power |stock_boot=btcode |stock_os=Linux;2.4.18;MIPS-01.00; |tp_firmware=Wive-NG |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=PheeNet |default_ip=192.168.1.254 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=00:1A:50 }} {{TagLine|802.11g 54Mbps High Power AP / Bridge}} :[http://www.ciudadwireless.com/pheenet_wap-654g_ieee802-11g_54mbps_b-repetidor_universal-p-1431.html Product page] ([http://www.pheenet.com/product/product_info?id=283&category_id=67&parent_id=6 Old]) ([http://www.pheenet.com/solutions?id=380 New]) :[http://www.pheenet.com/support?page=10 Support page] :[http://www.solwise.co.uk/downloads/files/wap-654g.pdf Datasheet] See also ''Pheenet WAP-654GP'' (int. splitter PoE) :2.2dBi detachable antenna (RP-SMA conn.) Base Platform: RTL8186 + RL2560 (MIPS R3000 ISA-1) [http://www.ciudadwireless.com/pheenet_wap-654g_ieee802-11g_54mbps_b-repetidor_universal-p-1431.html Spec.] Very simple access point with WIFI high output power (200mW) :that allows several wifi modes: * AP, WDS, AP + WDS, Client bridged, Ad-hoc * AP + Client bridged (aka Universal Repeater) The original firmware doesn't have Telnet or other remote CLI interface. :It only can be configured via web interface. It is worth mentioning the web interface doesn't allow to reboot the router, :however there is a hidden page that allows to execute custom commands: htt—Ä://192.168.1.254/syscmd.asp Some useful commands:
* Change the MAC adresss
flash set HW_WLAN0_WLAN_ADDR 001122334455
flash set HW_NIC0_ADDR 001122334455 * Change the regulatory domain
flash set HW_WLAN0_REG_DOMAIN 6 ===Tested firmwares=== Third party firmwares like [https://sourceforge.net/projects/wive-ng/ Wive-NG] were successfully tested in this unit. {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Version ! Link ! Notes |- | OEM 1.4c | [https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1PgJ-xZ5CoVopv2_0eSxG3B7EQ9szdJth WAP-654G(P)_v1.4c.zip] | doesn't seem to flash via tftp |- | OEM 1.4b | [https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=0B-EMoBe-_OdBY3cwSmhtbU8xUFk WAP-654G(P), F v1.4b 070228.rar] | |- | Wive-NG 0.3.18 | [https://sourceforge.net/projects/wive-ng/files/wive-ng/wive-ng-0.3.x/wive-ng-0.3.18.tar.7z wive-ng-0.3.18.tar.7z] | no web interface |- | Dlink 1.41-1 | [https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1aNtJI0oiG8euc8566Gt2Megt6472JZxJ DAP1160A1-OEM_MOD-1.41.zip] | modded firmware from Dlink DAP1160A1 GPL |} ===Serial=== {{SCollapse|Boot log |

# cat /proc/version 
Linux version 2.4.18-MIPS-01.00 (root@lnx103) 
(gcc version 3.3.3) #5 Thu Aug 10 13:14:01 CST 2006

# cat /proc/cpuinfo
system type             : Philips Nino
processor               : 0
cpu model               : R3000 V0.0
BogoMIPS                : 178.99
wait instruction        : no
microsecond timers      : no
tlb_entries             : 64
extra interrupt vector  : no
hardware watchpoint     : no
VCED exceptions         : not available
VCEI exceptions         : not available

sc emulations           : 0
===Flash backup=== # Connect the serial UART Adapter. Also connect the ethernet cable. # Set a static IP on your computer, use 192.168.1.35 (or any compatible) # Press the reset button, don't release it yet # Plug the power cord, and wait 5 seconds # Release the reset button # On the serial console execute the command: flr 80300000 0 200000 # On your computer execute: tftp 192.168.1.6 -m binary -c get flash-backup.bin You should see something like this at the serial console 
flr 80300000 0 200000
Flash read from 00000000 to 80300000 with 00200000 bytes ?
(Y)es , (N)o ? --> y
Flash Read Successed!

File Start: 80300000,length=00200000

**TFTP GET File flbackup.bin,Size 00200000 Byte
*TFTP Client Download Success! File Size = 00200000 Bytes
.Success!
=== Recovery === If you bricked the router by flashing a bad firmware follow these steps: # Connect the ethernet cable from your computer to the device. # Set a static IP on your computer, use 192.168.1.35 (or any compatible) # Press the reset button, don't release it yet # Plug the power cord, and wait 5 seconds # Release the reset button # On your computer execute: tftp 192.168.1.6 -m binary -c put valid-firmware.bin ''valid-firmware.bin'' is supposed to be a known firmware working ok on this device === Power regulators === * AnaChip AP1506-50 (U9 silkcreened): Main power regulator,12V input, 5V output * BS33P (U38 silkcreened): Low dropout regulator, 5V input, 3.3V output * BS17P (U10 silkcreened): Low dropout regulator (adjustable), 5V input, 3.1V output * BS18P (U8 silkcreened): Low dropout regulator, 5V input, 1.8V output. It runs extremely hot, probably causing unstability problems. It's recommended to install the bigger heat sink as possible. [[File:Wap-654g-power_regulators.jpg|400px]] ==Images== File:wap-654g-case.jpg|casing File:wap-654g-board_top.jpg|board top File:wap-654g-board_bottom.jpg|board bottom File:wap-654g-uart-jtag.jpg|serial port and JTAG [[Has images::internal| ]] __NOTOC__
